question: An agent that senses only partial information about the state cannot be perfectly rational.
Every agent is rational in an unobservable environment.
"Strikking av en sokk" involves a fully observable, deterministic, sequential, static, continuous, single agent miljø.
"Bidding in auction" involves a fully observable, strategic, sequential, static, discrete, multi-agent.
The Turing test evaluates a computer system’s ability to act rationally.
A stochastic environment is one in which the next state is completely determined by the agent’s action.
An advantage of Hill Climbing search is that it requires minimal memory.
A danger of depth-first search is that it may not terminate if the search space is infinite, even if a finite solution exists.
The knowledge, i.e, the content of the knowledge base determines the system’s performance while representation of knowledge determines its competence.
Principal of rationality (due to Allen Newell) maintains that the agent chooses actions in order to achieve its goal using the knowledge it has the knowledge it might gather.
This is procedural knowledge about two cities in Norway: bigger (Oslo, Trondheim)
An advantage of declarative knowledge is the storage economy, that is, representation of declarative knowledge needs less memory than procedural knowledge.
The production rules in a rule-based system is represented in the ”working memory”.
